utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I was wondering if you could tell me what brought you in?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Sure, you know I've been feeling kinda hot for the past couple of days and I have this terrible, terrible headache. And just my brain feels foggy. So I thought I should come get it checked out.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, I see when uh did these symptoms start exactly?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: So they started about 3 days ago. But it's getting worse.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Uh, and uh, in terms of the headache, uh, does your head hurt in any particular location?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I would say mostly the sides of my head.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and how long has the headache been going on for?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh the same amount of time, so like the past three days.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and um, how would you describe the headache? Is it like sharp, is it like a vice grip? Is it pulsating, pressure like sensation or none of those?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It you know it feels crampy.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Um, and has there been anything that triggered the headache or or made it worse?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I don't think so. Nothing is helping, sleeping is not helping, moving around is not helping. It's just always there.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, does the headache get worse with lying flat?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no, I wouldn't say so, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and are you feeling any pain down into your neck or into your shoulders or back?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And, would you say that this headache, which is was like worst headache of your life or thunder clap kind of sensation?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you had headaches like this before in the past?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, never.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And, how would you rate it in terms of severity, with 10 being the most severe that you could possibly have and one being not painful at all? How would you rate it?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I would say I would give it around a 6 or seven.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And have you had any nausea or vomiting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and how about any sensitivity to light when you're you're seeing it or sensitivity to sound?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you had any eye symptoms such as discharge, tearing or or itchiness?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um, and so you you mentioned that you had you had a fever as well. Did you check your temperature?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I didn't actually, no I didn't check my temperature, I just feel hot.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, we'll be sure to check that today in clinic. And have you been experiencing any other symptoms?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, just like the brain fog that I was speaking of, you know. I just don't remember, I remember things, but it's it's like I'm doing everything underwater.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Oh OK. Have you been uh confused or concerns with your memory?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, no, I haven't forgotten things. It just feels like I'm really slow at doing things.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I see, OK, and how has your energy been? Have you had uh significant fatigue?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yes, I would say I am significantly more tired than I used to be.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um, how has your sleep been?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: My sleep has been pretty normal. I go to bed around the same time, wake up around the same time. Yeah, I'd say that there's no issue there.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, with this fatigue, have you had any aches and pains?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Some muscle aches, I would say mostly in my arms and just my legs, yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you had a cough?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No cough, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, how about shortness of breath?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No shortness of breath either.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you experienced any chest pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how about any period where you felt as though your heart was racing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you have any wheezing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um no no wheezing.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you had any loss of taste or smell?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, alright have you noticed any rashes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No rashes either.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright. And have you had any abdominal pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you had any diarrhea?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um no, no diarrhea.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um and any constipation?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, and then how about any urinary problems such as painful urination or going frequently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no changes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And are you currently sexually active?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I am.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Could you tell me about your partners or partner?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Sure, I I just my husband, um we we don't use protection. But I'm on the birth control pill.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you had a sexually transmitted infection before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and any I guess like vaginal discharge or vaginal discomfort?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And, so next just wanted to ask a few questions about your past health. Have you been diagnosed with any medical conditions in the past?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so no diabetes, high blood pressure, anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, and do you take any medications regularly like prescription or over the counter?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I don't.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, so it's just the birth control?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh sorry, yes. Just the birth control pills.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah OK, no worries, and any allergies?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Just seasonal allergies.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and so are immunizations up to date?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yep, they are.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, and in in the home, is there anybody who's sick right now?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no one is sick.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Ok, how about at work?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I'm I'm a teacher. Um, so I work with a lot of children, but no one that I no one I know of has been sick.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um and so have you traveled anywhere recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright. And do you smoke cigarettes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I don't.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Do you smoke marijuana?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I don't.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright. Did you use any recreational drugs?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I sometimes take some marijuana edibles, but that's about it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and, do you purchase those at a dispensary?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I do.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so for one of the Ontario stores?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK great yeah 'cause you could never be sure where else, what the dosing is, so it's good to get it from the appropriate stores for sure.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Right.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Do you drink alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I do, I'll have a glass of wine with dinner.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK is this daily?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um most days I would say, maybe like four or five days of the seven days of the week.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, I see. And has anybody in your family had similar symptoms in the past to what you're having or had any lung conditions in the past?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how about any heart conditions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, my father passed away at 75 from a heart attack.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and uh, how about any cancers in the family?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: None that I know of.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. So I think that was, uh, all of the questions that I wanted to ask on history today. Was there anything else that you thought I was missing or that you wanted to tell me about?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I don't think so. But, uh, what do you think I have?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: So with the acuity of your symptoms, starting with the last few days and getting worse, especially with a fever which we now have documented of 38.8 and a kind of feeling, uh, tired with aches and pains and the headache, I am concerned that you have possibly a viral infection, and one of those possibilities could be COVID-19, but also it could be the influenza. It could be something like the common cold, such as adenovirus. So certainly we will do a PCR COVID swab as well as order some general lab work to look for signs of infection, such as a CBC and a white blood cell count. But um, for now we will get those tests ordered. Did you have any questions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: OK yeah that sounds great. Do you think I could also have you know, meningitis or something? 'Cause I was reading online on Google and that's the first thing that came up.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Oh yeah, you're you're absolutely right, so, um sorry, I we will go ahead and investigate that as well and we might need to do a lumbar puncture or some blood work to look for signs of infection that might be needed to be treated with antibiotics.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
